definition: to have stage fright
timid/cowardly/rustic/Taiwan pr. [que4]
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: But I knew I had to get past this nervousness.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我知道必須先解決怯場的問題。

sentences.english: Read some of the excellent books on stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 讀幾本克服怯場情緒的好書。

sentences.english: Insecurity and lack of self-confidence lead to stage fright and performance anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏安全感和自信是導致怯場和緊張的元兇。

sentences.english: Stage fright in public performance is the result of the contradiction and conflict.
sentences.chinese: 公開演奏中的怯場現象就是這種矛盾和衝突的產物。

sentences.english: The student got stage fright when he stepped into the exam room.
sentences.chinese: 學生一踏進考試室就有點怯場。

sentences.english: The good news is that you can conquer stage fright and get rid of it permanently.
sentences.chinese: 好消息是，你能夠克服怯場和擺脫它永遠。

sentences.english: Even great speakers may sometimes get stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 即便是著名的演說家，也有怯場的時候。

sentences.english: I myself, a rather shy person by nature who easily suffers from stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 我本人天性相當內向，很容易怯場。

sentences.english: Yeah, the height and speed gave her cold feet.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，過山車又高又快，嚇得她怯場。

sentences.english: He acted in an unhurried manner and didn't have any stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 表現得從容自若，一點都不怯場。

sentences.english: The fact that the same guy pukes on me every year from stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 因爲有個鳥人每年都因爲怯場而吐在我身上。

sentences.english: He'll bottle out when he goes on the stage.
Nervous illness can stem from being treated inconsiderately in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 怯場是因爲小時候受到了輕率的對待所致。

sentences.english: The actress had to learn to get over her fear of the public.
sentences.chinese: 這位女演員必須學會不怯場。

sentences.english: She went up on her lines out of fear on opening night.
sentences.chinese: 上演首晚她因怯場忘記了臺詞。

sentences.english: Sometimes I still suffer from stage fright.

definition: a cappella (loanword)
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
in deadly earnest/deadpan
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
to strut/swaggering
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
(idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
sand picture
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
talent show/talent competition
